English: Get on board and prepare for the road. Our orders are on my desk, make yourself familiar with them.
We were ordered to travel at coordinates {0}. Today, we will train.
Skipper, you need to see this immediately!
Skipper! The destroyer is readying its battle stations!
Damn, they declared the war on us.
Kohler, fast! Cut out Sommer or we all are done!
This time you’re off the hook. Get back to work!
Instead of free time you’ll be cleaning the toilets. It's the ideal place for people like you. And now get to work!
You’re under arrest. You’ll have time to think about your entire life.
Now you’ll experience your last honor in your wretched life - death at the hands of a Kriegsmarine officer.
You are still shivering... you coward!
A Kriegsmarine sailor is always alert. Be ashamed!
Burning scrambled eggs is something that we treat seriously on this boat.
The torpedo covered half the distance.
Set a course to these coordinates.
I won’t let them get us. Don’t be afraid my brothers!
Are you crazy? They'll detect us!
Be quiet! They will hear us.
Skipper! The diesel engines are damaged!
Admiralty is deeply impressed by your last patrol. Solid work captain!
These are current orders from the headquarters. Your eyes only.

Key: Depository Worker - What do You Need

English: Captain. This may be your new crew. Let me know, if you want to see their files.
Skipper, we're being pinged on sonar.

Key: A leak in the Stern Torpedo Room!
English: A leak in the Stern Torpedo Room!

Key: A leak in the Engine Room!
English: A leak in the Engine Room!

Key: A leak in the Crews Quarters!
English: A leak in the Crews Quarters!

Key: A leak in the Control Room!
English: A leak in the Control Room!

Key: A leak in the Officers Room!
English: A leak in the Officers Room!

Key: A leak in the Bow Torpedo Room
English: A leak in the Bow Torpedo Room

Key: A leak in the Conning Tower
English: A leak in the Conning Tower

Key: I will choose crew for the next assignment.
English: I will choose crew for the next assignment.

Key: Are there any orders from the admiralty?
English: Are there any orders from the admiralty?

Key: I would like to ask for a few favors...
English: I would like to ask for a few favors...

Key: Leading Officer - Welcome To Your New Flotilla
English: Welcome to your new flotilla. How can I help?
It's a pity that your last assignment didn't go well. Headquarters had great expectations. May the next mission be more successful.
Skipper! I hear a large group of ships. It seems to be a convoy.
Skipper! I hear a large group of ships.
I have to take a break soon...

Key: Battle of the Atlantic II Narration 01
English: Allies adapted to some of our tactics and battle of the Atlantic is now much different than it used to be.

Key: Battle of the Atlantic II Narration 02
English: Cargo ships headed at the Britain often travel in a heavily armed convoys across the Atlantic.

Key: Battle of the Atlantic II Narration 03
English: RAF Coastal Command has much more aircraft at the disposal. They are also better equipped.

Key: Battle of the Atlantic II Narration 04
English: Still, their defence strategy has a major weak spot in which we are going to hit...

Key: Battle of the Atlantic II Narration 05
English: We call it the Mid-Atlantic Gap. It's beyond the range of their aircraft and our u-boats can strike there more safely.

Key: Battle of the Atlantic II Narration 06
English: To overwhelm the defences of the convoys we will strike using a new tactic that we call a wolfpack attack.

Key: Battle of the Atlantic II Narration 07
English: We are going to win this battle, skipper.
